newsitem.title: BAHRAIN: Bahrain's index up 8.19 points in moderate trade.
newsitem.headline: Bahrain's index up 8.19 points in moderate trade.

text.p: Bahrain's share index ended the week to Thursday 8.19 points higher in moderate trade focused on banks and investment firms, the Bahrain Stock Exchange said.
It said the index climbed to 1814.82 points, the highest level this year, from 1,806.63 points last week.
Around 8.8 million shares worth 2.14 million dinars ($5.7 million) changed hands, down from 11 million shares worth 2.67 million dinars the previous week.
Shares of 25 of the 40 firms listed on the exchange were traded in 328 transactions.
The bourse said Bahrain Middle East Bank led the market with around 3.3 million shares worth 553,996 dinars changing hands. It ended two fils higher at 169 fils.
Investcorp shares rose two U.S. cents to $2.20. Around 373,000 Investcorp shares worth 307,140 dinars were traded.
National Bank of Bahrain and Bank of Bahrain and Kuwait were steady at 424 fils and 208 fils respectively.
United Gulf Bank lost one fils to 166 fils, Al-Ahli Commercial Bank increased two fils to 350 fils and Bahrain International Bank lost four fils to 180 fils.
